Here is an article I wrote on same-sex marriage.
 
 Any comments?
 
 http://www.newhumanist.org.uk/beyondgodandevil_more.php?id=1321_0_28_0_M
 
 Derek Kaill, president of the Humanist Association of London and Area (Ontario, Canada)

Being somewhat of a Humanist myself (or at least as a person who comes up as a Humanist on religious surveys and tends to agree with Humanist values), I do not feel there is any logical reason for a Humanist to oppose same-sex marriage. I feel there are plenty of logical reasons for them to support it, though.
 
 Actually, I feel that way about non-Humanists too...
